events.message: Applicant submitted a personal loan application to cover medical expenses and consolidate existing debt that has accumulated over the past year.
The application was reviewed by the system and categorised as a Personal Loan due to keywords referencing medical and debt-related purpose.
Loan officer Jessica Thompson was assigned to handle the personal loan application and assist the applicant throughout the process.
Initial review was conducted focusing on applicant credit history and stated loan purpose to assess eligibility and risk factors.
Requested proof of income, recent medical bills, and current debt statements to verify details provided in loan application.
Applicant submitted all requested documentation including income verification and medical expense reports timely.
Credit bureau report was retrieved and evaluated; credit score and history were consistent with risk parameters.
Comprehensive risk evaluation completed including debt-to-income ratio and repayment capability assessment.
An offer detailing loan amount, interest rate, and repayment schedule was presented to the applicant for consideration.
Applicant responded positively, accepting most loan terms but requesting slight adjustment on repayment duration.
Application was escalated to senior loan officer for review of requested repayment term modification.
Senior officer approved the loan with requested adjustments to repayment plan for better affordability.
Loan funds were disbursed directly to applicant’s account to cover medical bills and outstanding debts as planned.
Follow-up call confirmed applicant’s satisfaction with loan terms and clarified repayment schedule details.
Loan application was formally closed following successful funding and applicant’s confirmation of all conditions met.
